metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3477 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.5.49 and earlier, 5.6.30 and earlier, and 5.7.12 and earlier and MariaDB before 5.5.50, 10.0.x before 10.0.26, and 10.1.x before 10.1.15 allows local users to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via vectors related to Server: Parser.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3477` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.31-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.31-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.31-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.31-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.31-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.31-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.31-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.50-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.31-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
